column4: Hi guys! I have a Laptop HP6010p with dual batteries but ubunut only uses one of the batteries
this is a kernel issue, not Ubuntu per se
maybe, you'll need a custom-built kernel or the controller that manages the switch between the batteries is not supported
okay... I have 2 machines and both running ubuntu 10.10 but on the other laptop it works ..I' gonna check what kernel version that computer has
did u read the pastebin of my lspci? =)
sorry, no not yet, just a sec.
no panic I can see that u are really busy :)
I have read it, couldn't find any strange hardware. Intel HW is usually quite well supported on linux.
I am puzzled to not see any Power Management chip included on your list. No ACPI or something like that.

the thing is that I have 2 laptops they are almost the same , the only difference is that one is Centrino PRO and the other Centrino vPRO I have ubuntu on both machines.could the battery be broken since it says that energy when full 0 WH?
is this a multiboot system, or is Ubuntu the only OS installed on your notebook?
I'd try to find a LiveCD or something like it, that has a test suite for Intel chipsets. You might try Hirens BootDisk if you don't mind to step into a gray area when it comes to legal issues...
